intro: Perityle brandegeeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian perityle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in lowland and montane habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
